channel.title: Droid X
channel.description: I just picked myself a Droid X and my dad got a Droid 2 (he didnt want to carry a big screen around work). We both got unlimited plans since it actually ended up being cheaper seeing that they took off the 9.99 for each phone for family share. I really enjoy the big ass screen and watching movies and shit on it. Anybody know of any good apps or games that I should download from the Android market, and what are your opinions on this phone. Also the moparisthebest website mobile looks pretty good.

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:10, topic:374802”]@MITB:
http://www.htc.com/www/product/desirez/overview.html[/quote]

Not bad, and it looks like it’s going to come out as HTC Merge on verizon (CDMA version), but it really doesn’t look significantly better than my current Motorola Droid. 800mhz instead of 600mhz, 512 RAM instead of 256, and wireless N instead of G. Meh, I guess I’ll continue to wait. Good to see other companies still come out with keyboards though.

Read full topic

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:8, topic:374802”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=470768.msg3442654#msg3442654 date=1293168902]
I love my Droid, and the Droid X and 2 look like really big improvements, unfortunately Motorola neutured them so they can only run signed code, which means you can NEVER install a custom ROM on them ever (at least a custom kernel). It sucks, and until they change that I’ll never buy another Motorola.
[/quote]

At least you have the brilliant alternative that is HTC. They make so many Android phones and they are generally of a very high quality.[/quote]

Yes, HTC is great and so is samsung, but neither seems interested in a hardware keyboard like I need/love.

You can still root the phones I guess, but driodwall and such requires a kernel with iptables that you can never have, not sure if you can install modules.

Read full topic

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I love my Droid, and the Droid X and 2 look like really big improvements, unfortunately Motorola neutured them so they can only run signed code, which means you can NEVER install a custom ROM on them ever (at least a custom kernel). It sucks, and until they change that I’ll never buy another Motorola.

At least you have the brilliant alternative that is HTC. They make so many Android phones and they are generally of a very high quality.

Read full topic

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:6, topic:374802”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=470768.msg3442628#msg3442628 date=1293167719]
hmm I was trying to find swype but I cant figure out how to turn it on. Time to google that. Thanks for the link.
Also you might be right about the mobile theme. I haven’t gone on moparisthebest except for one time but it seemed easy to browse the topics
[/quote]
Yeah it’s a bit confusing how you turn it on, I think one time I managed to turn it on by either tapping the input box, or holding down on the input box and a little menu came up saying “select input” and I could choose between the default keyboard or the swype keyboard.

Try going to settings, then Language & keyboard, then you should be able to turn it on from there.[/quote]

Hmm I found the settings and it seemed to turn on by itself but dang it really works good makes it quicker since im not used to typing on a phone yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:3, topic:374802”]hmm I was trying to find swype but I cant figure out how to turn it on. Time to google that. Thanks for the link.
Also you might be right about the mobile theme. I haven’t gone on moparisthebest except for one time but it seemed easy to browse the topics[/quote]
Yeah it’s a bit confusing how you turn it on, I think one time I managed to turn it on by either tapping the input box, or holding down on the input box and a little menu came up saying “select input” and I could choose between the default keyboard or the swype keyboard.

Try going to settings, then Language & keyboard, then you should be able to turn it on from there.

Read full topic

I love my Droid, and the Droid X and 2 look like really big improvements, unfortunately Motorola neutured them so they can only run signed code, which means you can NEVER install a custom ROM on them ever (at least a custom kernel). It sucks, and until they change that I’ll never buy another Motorola.

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:

hmm I was trying to find swype but I cant figure out how to turn it on. Time to google that. Thanks for the link.

item.title: Droid X
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Also the moparisthebest website mobile looks pretty good.

Hmm I really disliked the mobile forum theme. Though I don’t have to worry as the browser I use on my mobile has a button to switch from mobile theme to normal theme. (That’s the skyfire browser).

As for apps, there’s plenty of them in this thread http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,466157.0.html

Personally I like angry birds the game, and air control. I use handscent sms as well as swype. Google skymap is a fun app also

Read full topic
